content:
1
FAQs
Company Management:
Q1: Do I need to be physically present to open a company 
A1: Physical presence is not required to set up a company 
Q2: Are there any paid-up share capital requirements 
A2: No paid-up share capital is required 
Q3: Do individual or corporate shareholders require NOC to incorporate a company at MFZ 
A3: NOC is not required to incorporate a company 
Q4: Can I apply for a 0-visa license 
A4: Yes, you can get a license with a zero-visa at Meydan Free Zone
Q5: Can I combine commercial, professional, and trading activities on the same license 
A5: Yes, the combination of activities is permitted 
Q6: What documents will the client receive upon incorporation of my company 
A6: - Business License
- Certificate of Formation
- Share Register
- Memorandum Of Association
- Lease Agreement
Q7: How many shareholders are permitted on the license 
A7: A maximum of 100 shareholders are permitted on the license, however, if a company has more than 6
shareholders, they will need to pay AED2000 for each additional shareholder beyond the initial 6  For
example, if a company has 10 shareholders, they will need to pay AED8000 (AED2000 x 4) in addition to the
standard licensing fees 
Q8: How many directors are permitted on the license 
A8: A maximum of 4 directors are permitted on the license 
Q9: How many managers are permitted on the license 
A9: A maximum of 1 manager is permitted on the license 
Q10: How many activities can be chosen free of cost during incorporation 
A10: You can incorporate the company with 3 groups of activities without any additional charge 
Q11: What is the cost of adding additional activities to the license  Does it require approval 
A11: The cost of additional activities is AED 1000 per activity  Approvals are required only for regulated
activities 
Q12: Is there a discount for multi-year license applications 
A12: For multi-year license applications, 2 or more years for license and visa allocations, there is a standard
discount of 15% 
Q13: Can I be a partner in more than one company 
A13: Yes, you can be a partner/shareholder in multiple companies 
Q14: What is the next step after submitting the new license application on the Meydan portal 
A14: the shareholders, manager, and directors will receive an email to complete the below tasks 
• KYC
• Accept/Reject
• Compliance form (if applicable) 
Only once the tasks are completed, our team will receive the application to review and proceed 
Q15: Does the license have a maximum period of validity - 3,5,10 years 
A15: Clients can choose the license validity during incorporation  The maximum period of validity is 10 years 
Q16: Will a multi-year license company get a free amendment 
A16: Yes, if the company holds a multi-year license, they will get a free amendment  (For example: If a company
has a 2-year license, the company will get 1 free amendment 
Q17: Is there a grace period after the license expires

Will a multi-year license company get a free amendment 
A16: Yes, if the company holds a multi-year license, they will get a free amendment  (For example: If a company
has a 2-year license, the company will get 1 free amendment 
Q17: Is there a grace period after the license expires 
A17: A 30-day grace period is provided from the license expiry date to renew the license 
Q18: Is there a penalty fee imposed by Meydan Free Zone, if the license is not renewed during the grace period 
A18: Yes, the penalty fee is AED 500  This is a one-time fee 
Q19: Is there a grace period after the immigration card expires 
A19: No, there is no grace period provided when the immigration card expires 
Q20: Is there a penalty fee imposed by Meydan Free Zone if the immigration card is expired 
A20: Yes, the penalty fee is AED 250 per month from the immigration card expiry date 
Q21: Can the share allocation and total share capital be a fraction 
A21: No, the share allocation and the total share capital cannot be a fraction  It must be a whole number 
(For example: It cannot be 45 50%, it must be either 45% or 46%) 
Q22: What address will be mentioned in the company license 
A22: Meydan Grandstand Next to Meydan Hotel 6th floor, Meydan Road, Nad Al Sheba, Dubai, U A E 
Q23: When would we be required to submit the Audit Financial Statement Declaration report 
A23: At the time of license renewal 
Q24: Can the client convert L L C to Branch OR the Branch to L L C 
A24: No, it’s not possible 
Q25: Can I have a shop outside the Meydan Free Zone area 
A25: No, you need to have a shop within Meydan Free Zone area 
Q26: Can the client change the address in the business license 
A26: Yes, the client can change the address in the business license, however, that address must be in the
Meydan Free Zone area ONLY 
Q27: Will I get a Chamber of Commerce certificate upon registering my company with MFZ 
A27: No, a Chamber of Commerce certificate will not be issued, however, Meydan Free Zone can assist you in
registering for the Chamber of Commerce, but a process fee will be applied 
Q28: Can I hold property under my Meydan Free Zone company 
A28: Yes, you can hold a property under your company 
Q29: How many visa allocations are available to the company 
A29: 6 visa allocations
Q30: Can I get a DET permit while having General Trading activity 
A30: No, it is not possible and the company one of the 44 mainland activities 
Q31: What is the immigration card 
A31: The immigration card is the card you are applying for to register your company details in the immigration
system and it’s mandatory to apply for it before applying for an employment OR investor/partner visa 
Q32: What is the visa allocation

the 44 mainland activities 
Q31: What is the immigration card 
A31: The immigration card is the card you are applying for to register your company details in the immigration
system and it’s mandatory to apply for it before applying for an employment OR investor/partner visa 
Q32: What is the visa allocation 
A32: Visa allocation is the visa quota in immigration and it’s mandatory to apply for it before applying for an
employment OR investor/partner visa 
Q33: Do the immigration card and visa allocation have different validity of business license 
A33: Immigration card and visa allocation have the same validity as the business license 
Q34: If the client is applying for a license amendment to change the company name  What will be the
publication time 
A34: 14 days 
Q35: Can the company provide their own MOA 
A35: The company can’t provide its own MOA, however, if they want to add/remove/edit any close in Meydan
MOA they can request for it, and it will be subject to legal approval 
Q36: What will be the fees if we select “Renewal with Amendment” during license renewal 
A36: There is no extra fees required unless they added 4th activity group 
Q37: What is the validity of corporate and employee letters 
A37: The validity is 30 days 
Q38: What should be the validity of a board resolution during an application submission on the portal 
A38: The board resolution must be valid for 15 days during application submission 
Q39: If the company wishes to cancel its license after the license has expired and after the grace period has
been completed, will the company have to pay the penalty fee 
A39: No, the company will not have to pay a penalty fee for the license, however, if the company has an
immigration card, they need to pay the immigration card fine 
Q40: Do I need to renew the Visa allocation even if the Visa Allocation was availed in the middle of the year 
A40: the visa allocation validity holds the expiry date of the License  Hence, should be renewed annually along
with a Business License and Immigration Card 
Q41: Does the client need to apply for an immigration card amendment after the company name has changed 
A41: The company must apply for an immigration card amendment once the company name is changed 
Q42: What are the minimum and maximum ages for shareholders 
A42: There is no minimum and no maximum age 
Q43: What is the minimum and maximum share capital can the company put 
A43: There is no minimum and no maximum share capital 
Employee management:
Q1: Do I need to be inside the UAE when processing the Residence Visa 
A1: An applicant has the option to process the Entry Visa outside the country  However, when the E-visa is
issued, the applicant needs to be inside the UAE to complete the medical and Emirates ID procedures 
Q2: How long is the Entry Visa valid

UAE when processing the Residence Visa 
A1: An applicant has the option to process the Entry Visa outside the country  However, when the E-visa is
issued, the applicant needs to be inside the UAE to complete the medical and Emirates ID procedures 
Q2: How long is the Entry Visa valid 
A2: The entry permit is valid for 60 days from the date of issuance 
Q3: How long is the change of status valid 
A3: The change of status is valid for 60 days from the date of issuance 
Q4: Do we have to submit our original passport during visa application 
A4: Visa stamping is no longer mandatory, as per the new regulations in the UAE  The electronic version will
suffice as Residency proof 
Q5: Can we process the Residence Visa before the Biometrics 
A5: You can submit the Residence Visa Application through the Portal  You may fill out and sign the Emirates
ID declaration form for us to proceed with the Residence visa issuance before Biometrics 
Q6: How much time does the client have to do the Biometrics if they fill out and sign the Emirates ID declaration
form to proceed with the Residence visa issuance before Biometrics 
A6: The client has 60 days to complete the Biometrics 
Q7: What are the minimum age criteria to apply for an investor/partner visa 
A7: The minimum age is 18 years  You must have AED50,000 share capital in the company to apply for an
investor/partner visa 
Q8: What are the maximum age criteria to apply for an investor/partner visa 
A8: There is no age limitation  You must have AED50,000 share capital in the company to apply for an
investor/partner visa 
Q9: What are the minimum age criteria to apply for an employee visa 
A9: The minimum age is 18 years 
Q10: What are the maximum age criteria to apply for an employee visa 
A10: The maximum age is 60 years 
General information:
Q1: What is the office timing for Meydan 
A1: We are operating 24/7 
Q2: Where is the Meydan Free Zone office 
A2: We are next to Meydan Hotel, Meydan Grandstand, 6th Floor, Meydan Rd, Nad Al Sheba 1, Dubai, UAE 
Q3: Can the client use Meydan's P O  Box number 
A3: It’s not allowed for the client to use Meydan's P O  Box number; however, the client can apply for their P O 
Box number through Meydan Plus 
Q4: Can the client put Meydan's office address for any delivery of goods/packages 
A4: Meydan Free Zone will not receive any delivery on the client’s behalf unless they register for Mail
management services 
Q5: Where is the Meydan share desk office 
A5: Meydan Grandstand, 6th floor, Meydan Road, Nad Al Sheba, Dubai, U A E
